It also comes down to where are we needed most. While Mike Pence would be one of numerous Republicans considering presidential campaigns, he would enter a race for governor as the favorite. a recent Gallup Poll. Presidents Jimmy Carter ( 45.3 percent), Ronald Reagan ( 43.3 percent) and Bill Clinton ( 45.9 percent) had lower approval rating averages during their second years in office, Gallup reports. Barack Obama 's low second-year ratings are due in large part to the struggles of the U.S. economy, Jeffrey M. Jones wrote for Gallup. "The other presidents with low second-year averages also took office during difficult economic times. Jimmy Carter Secretary of State Colin Powell said Barack Obama has made some achievements, but said Barack Obama must focus on job creation- the Bill Clinton 's most challenging task.
